$interpreted: Sherlock: Half price, or I won't buy it!
Antique Merchant: Half price!? This is an elder scroll! I stole this from the Kingdom of the Sun's Castle!
Antique Merchant: No way I'm letting it go for that cheap!

Sherlock: Hmph... Then I don't want it! 
That said...
Sherlock: I bet the Sunshine Infantry would be quite interested to hear what you just told me, don't you think?
Antique Merchant: Wha-wha-wha... Alright, hold on! Don't be hasty!

Antique Merchant: Fine. Half price! 
...Now you better give me a good deal next time I'm in your shop!
Sherlock: Knew you'd come around~

Sherlock: Now let's just see what this 'elder scroll' says...
From the Kingdom of the Sun's own treasure vault, it should be pretty nice~
Sherlock: You think... map to a sunken treasure chest? Or maybe plans to some old ultimate weapon?
Sherlock: ...The first born Mandora, known as the great hero...
Sherlock: traveling with his descendants and followers across the land...
Sherlock: finally found a place to settle down in the depths of the red mountains, establishing Mandora Kingdom...
Sherlock: What the heck is a Mandora!? What is this, some kind of children's story!? I want my money back!!
Sherlock: But if this is truly from the Kingdom of the Sun's treasure vaults...
Sherlock: If I found these mysterious 'mandora', I bet I would make a fortune!
Sherlock: Look, there's even a map here.
Sherlock: But the mountains around here are quite perilous indeed. Steep and littered with monsters...

Sherlock: No wonder all those rickety politicians never tried to look for them. 
Me, on the other hands... should be no problem!
Sherlock: That said... these mandora were so scared of strangers that they dug all the way down into mountain to set up their kingdom...
Sherlock: Scared of strangers, huh? Hmm... I think I've got a plan~
Steel-Dora: (Darn, that bird...!)
Guard Mandora: Dora!? Do! Ra! Do! Ra!
Steel-Dora: (Crap, I've been found out! Did that bird tell them to start attacking me!?)
Sharice: Just now, that was...
Steel-Dora: (Oh? Seems like they're not here to fight me.)
Steel-Dora: (I guess my disguise worked!)

Queen Mandora: Oooh~ So strong! So firm!
Yes, this must be the hero told about in the prophecy!
Puggi: This is your hero?
Steel-Dora: (Hero... prophecy? Does she mean...)
Steel-Dora: (Founding the Mandora Kingdom, then becoming king, then disappearing in his old age, returning to aid the kingdom in its time of need...)
Puggi: The queen said they've all been waiting for this hero to come back for ages~
Steel-Dora: (Is the queen talking about what I read in that elder scroll?)
Steel-Dora: (Hah! What luck!)
Sharice: Whoa, didn't you guys just see—
Steel-Dora: Dora~ Dooora~~

Steel-Dora: (Alright, now I'll just have to get them out of here.
One, two, three... agh, there's so many of them!)
Steel-Dora: (I'm gonna be rich rich rich!!)
Puggi: So, great hero, when are you plannin' on heading out?
Steel-Dora: Heading out? Where?
Puggi: To beat up that monster, duh! Save the king! This time the main character'll let you have your time in the spotlight.
Queen Mandora: Oh, hero of prophecy! Please, defeat this monster and save the king!
Queen Mandora: Good luck, we're all counting on you!
Steel-Dora: (What the heck? They... they can't force me to go, can they!?)
Steel-Dora: (I just wanted to make a little money! I can't fight any monsters!?)
Steel-Dora: (How did I get myself into this...?)

Hmph... Then I don't want it!
